data.text: Inflate Sleeping Pad with a Bicycle Pump
Hello, does anyone know of an adaptor that you would allow you to inflate your sleeping mat with your bike pump?
that’s what he said.
data.author: Kirsty Cambridge

data.text: boom boom
data.author: Kirsty Cambridge

data.text: don't use your mouth as you fill it with condensation which over time adds to the weight and shortern the life of your gear. Get a snozzle or a small rechargeable pump
data.author: John Climber

data.text:
Or save weight and hassle with this air mat; takes about 30 seconds to inflate and deflate..https://alpkit.com/products/cloud-base
Cloud Base inflatable sleeping mat
alpkit.com
data.author: Rich Smith

data.text: Depends on how you can inflate it. My Klymit has a small hand pump that goes on a spigot. I ditched that and used an old inner valve screwed into a bit of rubber hose I had, the bore was smaller than the spigot so I used a drill to enlarge. No more breath moisture messing your R-value up. You'll be surprised though how many pumps you need to do, your lungs are quite large. I had thought I could do similar for a mat with a large plug using an old valve, a straw and some Sugru. But I don't use that mat any more so never got round to it.
data.author: Will Pomeroy

data.text: I use a little battery pump for mine. It’s awesome.
data.author: Adrian Uttley

data.text: it’s a Thermarest so not sure if it will fit yours. It inflates and deflates. It’s not super fast but nice to set it off and put the tea on. Including 2xAA batteriedms it’s Weighs about 15g more than the pump sack.
data.author: Adrian Uttley

data.text: it’s a thermarest mat I have. Thanks
